args:
Some manner of disaster has befallen the
captive Sylvia, which has the prince and Melsa
concerned for her welfare. Suddenly, a powerful
foe called a Storm Sentinel appears. Hoping to
reach the village quickly, the party decides to
battle it head-on.
Oh, did you SEE that?! I am the BEST! \nWHO ELSE WANTS A PIECE OF SARISSE?!
Damn, kid. You ain't foolin' around.
Agreed, that was a splendid display of\nskill. She might even be stronger than\nher own brother.

Look, I won't deny that she's got some
serious bow skills, but she also has a
long way to go in the whole fighting
department.
For example, she's way too focused on\nwhat's in front of her. So if someone\nwere to hit her with a surprise atta—
Hey, that one came from the SIDE!\nThat's CHEATING!
Damn. That girl's got some serious\nsituational awareness going on.
I mean, yeah, she's a little timid, but a\nlittle of that'll keep ya alive longer.
And combined with Sarisse's abundant\ncourage, they make a potent pair.
Is something amiss, Luca?\nYou look rather put out.
Bwa ha ha! Aw, leave the poor guy alone.\nHe's just sad his baby sis don't need his\nhelp no more.
But maybe be happy about it, yeah?\nShe's all grown up now!
Grown up? Ha! She's barely half-grown,\nand that's WITH Melsa's help!
Still...I guess it's nice she managed to\nmake a friend.
Right then. That ought to do it for this\nbunch of fiends.
Phew! That was quite the adventure.
Are you okay, Melsa? I know you said you\ndon't really like to fight.
It's tiring going through one battle after\nanother like that, isn't it? How about we\nstop and take a breather?
I'm fine. We should push on.
It's not far to my village now.\nPlease follow me.
Without stopping for rest, Melsa and the rest of the\ngroup soldier on. Before long, the group draws\nnear a clearing associated with Sylvia.
Woooow! The view here is just gorge!\n...By which I mean gorgeous.\nNot a literal gorge.
Sylvia liked this place a great deal,\nand I used to visit often as well.
Sylvia loves nature—she's an incredibly\ngentle dragon.
I used to recline against her and gaze up\nat the clouds as they rolled past.
Ah, how I miss those times...
It is a relief that the Empire did not\nmanage to occupy this area.
But enough woolgathering. I must continue\nguiding you all to the villa—
Oh, thank the heavens you managed\nto escape!
Alas, I fear I come to you now as mere\nconsciousness. I am but a phantom\nvision without form.
However, we've not the time left to\ncontinue bandying words.
Hear me, Melsa. Hear me well...
You must not attempt to rescue me.
Wh-what do you mean? All that I've done\nto this point has been for you!
Great Prince {player_name}...\nI know you carry within you\nthe strength of dragons...
Please...you must take Melsa and flee\nthis place... Before it is too late...
Buh?! She disappeared! The heck's\ngoing on here, {player_name}?!
I'm not sure—but I have a really bad\nfeeling about it.
Agreed. I think we would be well-served\nby some haste.
Something terrible must have happened\nto Sylvia...
Phew! I'm glad we caught up to you.
Wait, Your Majesty! Look there!\nWhat manner of fiend is that?!
That is one of the Empire's servants.\nThe ones even Sylvia couldn't defeat.
Wait, that thing's stronger than a dragon?\nSo what the heck are WE supposed to do\nabout it?!
Well, it's moving in a regular pattern,\nalmost like it's patrolling a set route.
We should learn said pattern, find an\nopening, and slip through when we can.
Eh, I ain't really much for stealth.\nBesides, that thing'll hear us\ncomin' a mile away.
We don't have time to sneak about or\nmemorize routes—we have to get to\nthe village and save Sylvia now!
But hey, if my bestie is for it,\nthen I am too! Let's do this thing!
Well, I suppose a direct frontal assault\ndoes have SOME merits...
We came here to save the sylvan people\nand their dragon, and we're going to do it.
